explanation: The original line only checked x % 100 == 0, which wrongly accepts X = 0. Because the purse has at least one 100-yen coin, X must be a positive multiple of 100. I changed the condition to require x > 0 in addition to divisibility by 100. This follows the same pattern as the retrieved diffs that add an extra boolean condition to the existing check (e.g. adding another clause in Diff 2/3).
fixed_code:
x = int(input())
print('Yes' if x%100==0 and x>0 else 'No')
